ml.alternet.security.auth.hashers.impl

Class HasherBase<T extends CryptParts>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ml.alternet.security.auth.hashers.impl.HasherBase<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The kind of crypt parts to support.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Credentials.Checker, Hasher
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Argon2Hasher, BCryptHasher, MD5BasedHasher, MessageHasher, PBKDF2Hasher, PlainTextCryptFormat.PlainTextHasher, SaltedMessageHasher, SHA2Hasher, UnixCryptHasher

    public abstract class HasherBase<T extends CryptParts>
extends Object
implements Hasher
    Convenient base class for hasher implementations. Only 2 methods have to be implemented : one for initializing a new fully configured crypt parts, the other for encrypting the credentials with the parts (typically, the salt if any).
    Author:
    Philippe Poulard

      • encrypt

        public String encrypt(Credentials credentials)
               throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Description copied from interface: Hasher
        Compute a crypt from credentials.

        By default, the user is ignored.

        Specified by:
        encrypt in interface Hasher
        Parameters:
        credentials - Credentials, that must contain at least the password.
        Returns:
        A crypt.
        Throws:
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - When the hash algorithm fails.

      • check

        public boolean check(Credentials credentials,
                     String crypt)
        Specified by:
        check in interface Credentials.Checker

      • encrypt

        public abstract byte[] encrypt(Credentials credentials,
                               T parts)
        Encrypt some credentials.
        Parameters:
        credentials - The credentials to encrypt.
        parts - Contains additional data (typically the salt) used for encryption ; the hash field MUST NOT be updated by this method during encryption : it's up to the caller to determine if the result has to be compared to the hash field (checking credentials) OR to set the result in the hash field (encrypt credentials).
        Returns:
        The result hash.

      • initializeParts

        public abstract T initializeParts()
        Initialize the crypt parts (typically generate a salt).
        Returns:
        A new crypt parts with its fields initialized except its hash field.
